intro: Pedicularis condensata, commonly known as the condensed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often on rocky slopes or in meadows. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lips and a spur that extends downward. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and its ability to form dense colonies in suitable environments.
